Unfortunately this does not lead to stable societies, but rather warlords who rise and fall, usually within a few years, and who war amongst themselves. These warlords are generally High Orcs, a breed that has long separated itself from their kin, favoring skill in leadership or sorcerous magic over pure brute strength. Far to the south, in Nerim, the Sand Orc tribes roam.

#### Orc Culture in Elthelas

The Orcs in Elthelas are far more organized and varied than orcs in most settings. Their tendency towards chaos has been tempered by a natural respect for strength and a natural willingness to follow those who are stronger than they. This enables strong and ambitious warlords who can persuade others to follow them to build up strength and power. Their vast territory of fertile land also means that they developed farming, culture, and civilization right alongside the other nations of the world. While they lack a natural prediliction towards feats of the mind, building a great building can be seen as a sign of strength just as much as personal combat. Their numerical superiority over their early neighbors, the goblinoids and gnolls, enabled them to dominate these other races, enslaving them or otherwise manipulating them towards their own ends.

Orc culture is focused on achieving personal strength and skill. Every town of size has regular gladiatorial tournaments, where warriors, both free and slave, compete against each other. Success in the tournaments is considered an excellent way to attract a mate, for both men and women, and comes with substantial prizes that can help to jumpstart a new household. Farming among the orcs focuses on the raising of livestock, particularly pigs, chickens, or other animals that require little feed to raise to adulthood.

Medicine and magic among the orcs is most often practiced by witch doctors living on the fringes of society, or elites who use their sorcery to outwit their peers.  The church of Mat'raktha always has a firm hand in the order of society, intervening when clan wars become hot enough to threaten the cohesion of orcish society, and demanding the proper rights from any warlord who wishes to sit on the council in Marinval. A cleric may be consulted by both sides in a clan dispute before hostilities progress to blood, and that cleric may suggest alternative remedies to all-out war, such as a gladiatorial bout between clan champions, or a peace settlement to prevent a larger clan from wiping out a weaker one.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Orcs are somewhat larger and bulkier than humans, and they range from 5 to well over 6 feet tall. Your size is medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 9m.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You can see in dim light within 18m of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Menacing
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the intimidation skill.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

subraces.name: Grunt Orcs
subraces.description: The grunt orcs have never really been able to rule themselves in any organized or permanent manner. When they haven't been ruled by outsiders or their high orc brethren, they have generally been little more than tribal, ruled by whatever warlord happened to be the strongest. Grunt Orcs are the strongest of the orc breeds, and make up the bulk of the orc armies. When not at war they often compete in feats of strength, including blood sports.

traits.name: Savage Attacks
traits.description: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

traits.name: Blood Scent
traits.description: When an opponent is reduced to half or fewer hitpoints, the scent of the blood can send you into a sort of frenzy. Attacks against foes with half or fewer hit points do an extra 2 damage.

subraces.name: High Orcs
subraces.description: The high orcs are less strong, and slightly smaller than grunt orcs, and more than a bit lazy, but they make up for it with greater social skills and diplomatic nature. They tend to be the rulers in Orc society, playing others off each other to rise to the top in orcish politics, befriending the strongest grunt orcs, and using them as champions as they rise to the top of society. Many of the high orcs live apart from their kin, on the island nation of Olda, where they keep vast hordes of slaves to do their bidding, watched over by highly paid mercenaries.

traits.name: Commanding Presence
traits.description: You have been born and bred for leadership. You have advantage on all Charisma (Persuasion) and Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

subraces.name: Sand Orcs
subraces.description:
The Sand Orcs are an offshoot of Grunt Orcs that have taken up a nomadic lifestyle in the deserts of Nerim. They are a hardy people, and excellent riders, making use of powerful riding lizards for travel. They move from oasis to oasis in wandering tribes, and have little contact with the outside world.

Sand Orcs are leaner compared to their Grunt Orc and High Orc cousins, and their skin more brown and tan than green.

traits.name: Savage Attacks
traits.description: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

traits.name: Fire Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.

documents.name: Sorceron Blooded
documents.description:
the Sorceron were a race of Godly servants that served all Gods. Originally serving the Gods in creating the world Elthelas and the many interconnecting planes of existence in an age long since forgotten. They were masters of magic, the inventors of the arcane arts. In the Gods War they served on both sides, and were the primary combatants, and while most of them died in that conflict, some few survivors retreating to other planes of existence besides the material with the Gods. Yet, before that age many Sorceron interbred with the races of Elthelas, and every now and then a child will be born with more Sorceron blood than typical. These unusual children show a rare talent for magic and are gifted with intelligence and charisma far beyond that of their kin.

The Sorceron Blooded look very similar to a normal human, but their blood typically betrays them when they are young, with their gift for magic blooming almost as soon as they can talk.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: The Sorceron-blooded are generally similar to elves or humans in height, weight, and build. Your size is medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 9m.

traits.name: Natural Spellcaster
traits.description: Choose one cantrip from the sorcerer or wizard spell list, and one first level spell from the same list. You can cast this cantrip at will, and the first level spell once per short rest without expending a spell slot. The spellcasting ability for these spells depends on the list you chose it from. Charisma for a sorcerer spell, or intelligence for a wizard spell.

subraces.name: Human Born
subraces.description: Sorceron Blooded born of humans tend towards more versatility than many others. Often rising to positions of leadership and influence.

traits.name: Versatility
traits.description: Gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

subraces.name: Elf Born
subraces.description: Sorceron Blooded born of elves retain much of the fey grace of their parents, but with a spellcasting ability beyond even most elves.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Trance
traits.description: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is 'trance') While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: Thanks to your elf blood, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 18m of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

subraces.name: Dwarf Born
subraces.description: Sorceron Blooded born of dwarves are hardy folk, with a keen intellect, often discernible from other dwarves only by their unnatural gift with magic.

traits.name: Dwarven Resilience
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 18m of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Dwarven Combat Training
traits.description: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, throwing hammer, and warhammer.

subraces.name: Orc Born
subraces.description: Sorceron Blooded born of orcs are growing increasingly common since the awakening of the Prince of Fiends, as the Prince enjoys his carnal pleasures, and many an orc woman dreams of the prestige of bearing a child of the prince. As the first generation of orc born sorceron blooded has reached maturity they have been recruited into the highest echelons of orc society, serving as blackguards, warlords, and mages in service of the Prince.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You can see in dim light within 18m of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Menacing
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the intimidation skill.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

documents.name: Tabaxi
documents.description:
The Tabaxi are a catlike people that wander the world in small bands, often stopping in small villages to trade. They rarely if ever have permanent homes, and largely keep to themselves in their wandering. They can be found in most any nation, but actively tracking one down can be incredibly difficult. It is rare that a band of Tabaxi, typically no more than 10 to 20 in number including children, will stay in a particular town longer than a few days. Tabaxi who come of age will typically leave the band they were born in, wandering alone until they either find a new band to marry in to, or meet up with other young wanderer on their own and form a new band.

#### Tabaxi Culture in Elthelas

Tabaxi love to tell stories, play music, and dance. Most nights in a Tabaxi camp are spent on these pursuits. Tabaxi bands are typically pacifists, as most nations regard the Tabaxi as a nation without a state, and may consider any violence perpetrated by a Tabaxi as an attack by all Tabaxi against their people, often leading to violent retribution. This typically leaves them incredibly careful to avoid conflicts with others, and if a trade relationship with a particular town turns sour, the Tabaxi will simply leave and not return. It also means they are susceptible to bandits and outlaws, who often claim in court that the Tabaxi attacked *them*, and they simply defended themselves. Tabaxi bands thus generally avoid areas of great turmoil.

Meanwhile, in distant Asura, their still exist cities of Tabaxi in the eastern forests of that land.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Tabaxi are taller on average than humans and relatively slender. Your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 9m.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You have a cat's keen senses, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 18m of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Feline Agility
traits.description: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turnin combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

traits.name: Cat's Claws
traits.description: Because of your claws, you have a climbing speed of 6m. In addition, your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. They have the light and finesse properties, and do 1d6 slashing damage.

traits.name: Cat's Talent
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Perception and Stealth skills.

documents.name: Tieflings
documents.description:
Tieflings are the descendents of humans that have mated with demons or devils, they bear the mark of this touch in their appearance and nature. They often bear demonic traits, such as horns, forked tails or tongue, or reddish skin or eyes. They also tend towards evil more than the average person, and although this is far from a given, it is common enough that the distrust that follows them everywhere is justified.

Tieflings are not quite as rare as Aasimar (given demons' proclivity for lust), although they are still rare enough to cause a stir in any town they show up in, especially given their heritage. Tieflings are more common in the west, where demons, and demon attacks, are also more common. Tieflings of a good or neutral persuasion can usually find shelter in Dera'Dragorim or Zelfir, the second as a service to Amathera as a pity of their natural plight, and the first in recognition of a shared victimization at the hands of aggressive demon invaders.

#### Tiefling Culture in Elthelas

The distrust that tieflings face at the hands of common folk, combined with the chaos in their blood, leads many to take up life as an adventurer or wanderer. Some find their way to the tiefling enclaves in more friendly cities, while many find themselves taken advantage of by evil lords who give them opportunities where no one else would. The largest population of settled Tiefling's in Elthelas is in the Deran city of Vasha. There it is common enough to see someone with horns or a forked tongue walking down the street that few pay it any mind. The Tiefling's there have found a niche working as alchemists, smelters and smiths, as well as other jobs where their natural resistances give them an edge over an ordinary human. These Tieflings are well integrated into Dera'Dragoran society.

Elsewhere in the world tieflings have evolved their own counter cultures. For example, In Malinval Tieflings are subject only to the church of Mat'raktha, and have a near monopoly on intercity trade, since they are the only race not subject to the warlords or mandatory slavery.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: Thanks to your infernal heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 18m of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
traits.description: You have resistance to fire damage.

subraces.name: Human Demon Tiefling
subraces.description: Most tieflings are the descendents of humans and demons, and the unions are rarely consensual, though sometimes they are several generations back. These children are often outcasts. Reminders to their families of the horrible things in their pasts, and feared as carrying the disposition of their demonic progenitors.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Tieflings have about the same size and build as humans. Your size is medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 9m.

traits.name: Infernal Legacy
traits.description: You know the thaumatergy cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the hellish rebuke spell once per long rest as a 2nd-level spell. Once you reach 5th level you can cast the darkness spell once per long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subraces.name: Fey'ri
subraces.description:
At the time of the demon invasion, Dera was home to the largest elven community outside of Eldoran. Unfortunately for these elves, their community was among the first attacked by the demons. Throughout most of the world it is believed that all of the elves were slaughtered, however a small percentage were kept as slaves, serving the whims of their demon masters, and subject to their lusts. Many of them died birthing the demonic offspring of these unions, and those who did not were rendered infertile. When Bahamut turned his wrath on the demons, forcing them to flee, they left their slaves, and their offspring, behind. These elves, trapped between an angry God and demon slave-masters, hid in the sewers of the ruined city, where they have lived since, expanding them as they had need of space. Over time they have intermarried and the demonic blood has spread and become diluted throughout their people. Today they rarely leave their underground home, but occasionally one will leave to travel the world. They are typically mistaken for a pointy eared , skinny and winged tiefling, and they rarely find a welcoming reception. Most return home.

Fey'ri have a naturally evil disposition, and the society as a whole has largely given into the call of their blood. The underworks of Dera where they live is a harsh environment where only the strongest are permitted to survive.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 9m. You also have a flying speed of 9m.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Trance
traits.description: Fey'ri don't need to sleep. Instead they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is 'trance') While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

subraces.name: Human Devil Tiefling
subraces.description: The most rare of the tieflings are those born of devils. Unlike demons these unions are typically at least nominally consensual, with the human parent often trading sex for something else. Some of the these are the children of incubi and sucubi, where the parent has traded their soul for carnal pleasures, while others are the children of other devils who have given some other material benefit to the human parent in trade for their own pleasure. Nevertheless, the children are still rarely wanted, and just as reviled in the community as other tieflings.

traits.name: Devil's Tongue
traits.description: You know the vicious mockery cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the charm person spell as a 2nd-level spell once with this trait. When you reach 5th level , you can cast the enthrall spell once with this trait. You must finish a long rest to cast these spells once again with this trait. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for them.

subraces.name: Tanarukk
subraces.description: Among the orcs it is considered an honor to be chosen by a fiend for breeding purposes. The children of these unions are the wild and unruly Tanarukk. Their fiendish blood accentuates their already aggressive nature, making them unpredictable but powerful weapons of war, but even in orc society they are treated as creatures to be feared rather than helped.

traits.name: Menacing
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the intimidation skill.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

documents.name: Tortles
documents.description: The simple, peaceful, half-turtle Tortle people live in small cities along the coasts of Asura. They are the most welcoming of outsiders of all of the beast races of Asura, willingly accepting traders into their ports, though there are not many.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Tortle adults stand 5 to 6 feet tall and average 450 pounds. Their shells account for roughly one-third of their weight. Your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 9m.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. They have the light and finesse properties, and deal 1d6 slashing damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time. Tortles aren't natural swimmers, but they can remain underwater for some time before needing to come up for air.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: Due to your shell and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your shell provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

traits.name: Shell Defense
traits.description: You can withdraw into your shell as an action. Until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to AC, and have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in your shell, you are prone, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to emerge from your shell.

traits.name: Survival Instinct
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the Survival skill. Tortles have finely honed survival instincts.

documents.name: Trollkin
documents.description:
Oft described by those who meet them as 'damn ugly, but damn efficient killers', trollkin are gangly, thick chested humanoids with disgustingly angular faces, long pointed noses, and grey-green to brown skin. Strong and hardy, they are somewhat larger than an orc, and have clawed hands.

The trollkin were originally created during the dawning years of the world as a magical experiment in interracial breeding. The end result was something akin to a fast maturing, highly stunted troll, and was cast out by its Sorceron creators as a failure and released into the wild. Yet the trollkin's improved intellect in comparison to their troll progenitors, ability to breed quickly, and fit into other societies (with a bit of care and luck), enabled the Trollkin to thrive where trolls were hunted and killed. During the God's War, the trollkin were conscripted as foot soldiers into the armies of every side, and by the end of the war, only a few hundred remained alive. Nevertheless, these few hundred managed to find a land of their own on a large island that they named Degak'Ta, and from there they have spread out to various lands once again.

The trollkin, unlike every other major race on Elthelas, are naturally antitheistic. They generally feel the Gods betrayed their people in the God's War, using them as pawns, sending them to their deaths, and in the end, providing no reward. Politically, they tend to discount charisma as useless, rewarding strength and cunning. In their homeland of Degak'Ta they are ruled by the military, lead by the Grand Marshal, who gains office through contests of strength and tactics. In foreign affairs they are generally aloof, not taking sides in conflicts as a people, and instead hire out individually or in small groups as mercenaries to either or any side, and they are highly valued as such.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Trollkin range from 7 feet to 8.5 feet tall, and typically weigh between 250 and 350 lbs. Your size is medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 9m.

traits.name: Hard to Kill
traits.description: You have advantage on death saves.

traits.name: Face of a Troll
traits.description: Trollkin have disadvantage on any charisma check except intimidation checks made to influence an NPC who is not a Trollkin or Troll.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. They have the light and finesse properties, and deal 1d6 slashing damage.

traits.name: Brute
traits.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the trollkin hits with it.

documents.name: Yuan-ti Pureblood
documents.description: From the jungles of Ssitsu occasionally emerges one of the Yuan-ti's spies. The Purebloods sit on the bottom of Yuan-ti society, but are useful for their ability to appear human. These spies spread out throughout Elthelas, sending information back to Ssitsu to further the interests of the Yuan-ti.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Purebloods match humans in average size and weight. Your size is medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 9m.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You can see in dim light within 18m of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.description: You know the poison spray cantrip. You can cast animal friendship an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can only target snakes with it. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast suggestion with this trait. Once you cast it, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Poison Immunity
traits.description: You are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.

documents.name: Custom
documents.description: This is here in case your DM allows you to play a custom race or subrace or one from a sourcebook that is not by default included in the setting. Add your own features.
